intro: Bumelia socorrensis, commonly known as the Socorro bumelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological features. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, characterized by its smooth, often reddish bark and opposite, simple leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals. Bumelia socorrensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native range.
